channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: European privacy group claims Android's ad-tracking code is illegal
item.description: A privacy campaigner has filed a complaint in France claiming that Google's Android Advertising Identifier violates EU law.

item.title: Ring brings its radar-scanning tech to a floodlight camera
item.description: The new floodlight camera lets you see a breadcrumb trail of someone's path to your door.

item.title: Tesla takes to Chinese social media to ease local spying fears
item.description: Tesla is using its Chinese social media page to assuage local spying fears after its cars were banned from the country's military facilities and select state-owned companies.

item.title: Alienware's M15 and Dell's G15 gaming laptops are getting AMD Ryzen CPUs
item.description: Dell is finally bringing AMD CPUs back to its gaming laptops on the Alienware M15 and Dell G15.

item.title: The best wireless headphones you can buy right now
item.description: Here's a list of the best wireless headphones you can buy right now, as reviewed by Engadget editors.

item.title: UK launches new watchdog to govern the dominance of Big Tech
item.description: The UK has launched its Digital Markets Unit, a new watchdog tasked with ensuring that the likes of Facebook and Google cannot abuse their power to block out competitors.

item.title: The Morning After: Our verdict on the Sonos Roam
item.description: Sonos just delivered the Roam, but it has a more secretive speaker on the way.

item.title: Tesla offers 50 percent discounts on overnight Supercharger use in California
item.description: Tesla is giving California owners a 50 percent discount on their charging fees if they plug into a Supercharger between 7PM and 10AM.

item.title: Fujifilm's $100 Instax Mini 40 offers vintage looks and simple features
item.description: Fujifilm has unveiled the Instax Mini 40, an instant film camera much like last year's Instax Mini 11 but with a new retro look and $30 higher price tag.

item.title: Polestar wants its cars to be carbon-neutral by 2030
item.description: Volvo’s performance EV subsidiary Polestar is reportedly taking steps to go greener than any electric auto manufacturer before it. As part of the company’s inaugural release of its annual review and sustainability report, Polestar announced on Wednesday that it plans to produce only carbon-neutral vehicles by 2030.

item.title: Chevrolet will build an electric Silverado with 400 miles of range
item.description: General Motors President Mark Reuss has announced the electric Silverado pickup.

item.title: 'Pac-Man 99' battle royale launches Wednesday on Nintendo Switch
item.description: Nintendo and Bandai are launching a battle royale 'Pac-Man' game for the Switch.

item.title: Feds allege actor's $690 million Ponzi scheme lied about selling movies to Netflix
item.description: A small-time actor has been arrested and charged with fraud for allegedly stealing hundreds of millions from investors by claiming he could sell film rights to Netflix and HBO.

item.title: BioWare details the gameplay changes coming to 'Mass Effect: Legendary Edition'
item.description: BioWare says combat in the original Mass Effect should feel snappier. Driving in the Mako is also smoother.

item.title: Sonos and IKEA are developing new Symfonisk speakers that hide in plain sight
item.description: According to a new report, one of the new devices IKEA and Sonos are working on is a speaker that will double as an art piece.

item.title: Apple opens Find My to third-party testing
item.description: The software allows MFi (Made for iPhone) licensees to test their hardware for use on Apple's Find My network.

item.title: Facebook banned an Albanian troll farm supporting exiled Iranian militants
item.description: Facebook took down more than 1,000 fake accounts in March, including a few hundred that were tied to a troll farm in Albania.

item.title: This browser game shows the limits of AI emotion recognition software
item.description: As you play the game, what you’ll notice is that it’s easy to fool the software. You can fake a smile to trick it into thinking that you’re happy. Ultimately, that’s the point of the experience.

item.title: Apple TV+ will stream another 'Mythic Quest' bonus episode ahead of season two
item.description: Anthony Hopkins guest stars in 'Everlight,' an episode about a post-quarantine return to the office.

item.title: Remembering LG's finest (and strangest) phones
item.description: LG has never been the biggest, most important smartphone maker, but consumers always benefit from more competition — it drives smartphone makers to innovate faster, and to make those innovations more affordable. But nothing lasts forever. Rather than sit around all glum, though, I think our time is better spent remembering some of the truly great — and truly wild — phones LG has made over the years.

item.title: YouTube says it's doing better at removing videos that go against its policies
item.description: Short for Violative View Rate, the stat details the percentage of views on YouTube that come from content that violates the company's community guidelines.

item.title: 'Overwatch' gets full support for NVIDIA's low-latency Reflex tech
item.description: Landing a headshot should be slightly easier.

item.title: GM is betting its electrified future on a revolutionary new battery system
item.description: When the Hummer EV SUT (sport utility truck) and its newly-unveiled SUV variant hit dealer show floors in the fall of 2021 and 2023, respectively, they’ll be among the first models in GM’s new electrified lineup to be built atop the company’s Ultium battery system.

item.title: eBay's app will soon use image recognition to automate listing trading cards
item.description: eBay is making it easier and much faster to list individual cards to its platform for sale.

item.title: 'Grand Theft Auto V' returns to Xbox Game Pass on April 8th
item.description: You'll be able to play Rockstar's blockbuster on your phone via the cloud.
